intro: Ixia helmei, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a striking perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, spiky inflorescences that bear bright orange or red tubular flowers. The plant has strap-like, narrow leaves that are typically evergreen and can grow up to 1 meter in height. Ixia helmei thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its unique appearance and long blooming period make it a standout in both garden and horticultural settings.
